result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:13 AM Defendant Averion B Thomas in court.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III in court for Averion B Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests one last status date to work on global offer.
BTC: Matter set over for COP if it doesnt go then it can be treated as a status date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program

ADDRESS INFO for Averion B Thomas
Current: 5643 Byrd Ave #101, Racine, WI 53406 United States  (Effective: 08-02-2022)
Prior: 4040 Erie St #2, Racine, WI 53402
Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:41 AM Defendant Averion B Thomas in court.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III in court for Averion B Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense requests another status date and indicates the amended bond will be signed this morning. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact with the co-defendant.

AMENDED 8/16/2022 the Defendant's exceptions to house arrest in the above-referenced matter shall be amended to allow him to attend the birth of his soon to be born child as well as any prenatal doctor appointments. That the Defendant will notify RCAP of any prenatal appointments in advance and contact RCAP, and leave if message if necessary, that he is on the way to the hospital to attend the birth.
Bond Modif Stip & Order attend birth
